intro: Ruschia unca, commonly known as the mountain ruschia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent species is characterized by its compact growth habit and fleshy, cylindrical leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the summer months. Ruschia unca is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
